tournament.name: ANZ Super Series Cycle 7 Regional Championships

decks.notes: This deck focuses on using the combination of Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Indomitable Creativity to quickly summon powerful creatures from the deck. With cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push for control, as well as Fable of the Mirror-Breaker for additional combo potential, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its creativity and versatility. Valgavoth, Terror Eater and Titan of Industry provide additional threats, while cards like Blazemire Verge and Pawpatch Formation help ensure mana consistency. Overall, this deck looks to surprise and outmaneuver opponents with its unique combo plays and strategic choices.

This aggro Rakdos deck focuses on using fast, efficient creatures and spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck includes cards that boost the power of creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push. With a low mana curve and a focus on aggressive plays, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game and secure a quick victory. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells. It utilizes cards like Bloodtithe Harvester and Unstoppable Slasher to put pressure on the opponent early in the game, while also running a suite of removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to close out games. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the aggressive game plan while providing enough consistency for the deck to function smoothly.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature drops and direct damage spells to overwhelm opponents quickly. By utilizing low-cost and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, alongside powerful pump spells like Infuriate and Monstrous Rage, this deck can deal significant damage in a short amount of time. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional flexibility and consistency to the deck. With a solid mana base and access to versatile removal spells like Fatal Push, this deck is designed to take control of the board early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenixes, using cheap spells like Consider and Fiery Impulse to trigger their return. Picklock Prankster helps with the discard strategy, while Treasure Cruise and Artist's Talent provide card advantage. The deck also includes some control elements like Spell Pierce and Lightning Axe. Overall, the goal is to pressure the opponent with fast, recurring threats while maintaining card advantage and control over the game.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with hasty creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to use cheap, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger to deal damage quickly, while also having access to removal spells like Fatal Push and Reckless Rage to deal with opposing threats. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while using pump spells like Infuriate and Monstrous Rage to finish off the game. Overall, the deck prioritizes speed, aggression, and efficient removal to secure victories.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Companion ability of Jegantha, the Wellspring to enable a powerful combo strategy. The deck includes a mix of ramp creatures, control elements, and powerful combo pieces like Collected Company and Acererak the Archlich. By consistently using Jegantha as a companion, the deck aims to generate mana quickly and efficiently to cast its key combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with a fast and synergistic strategy.

The deck focuses on using Transmogrify to turn a token into a powerful creature like Valgavoth, Terror Eater or Case of the Stashed Skeleton. The main goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress while efficiently removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Torch the Tower. The inclusion of Fable of the Mirror-Breaker adds consistency to setting up the combo. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure smooth gameplay and access to all necessary colors.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cheap spells and then utilize the Arclight Phoenix to bring them back for repeated attacks. The deck also contains a mix of disruption spells and card draw to maintain momentum and keep up pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Picklock Prankster provides additional ways to trigger the Phoenix's ability while also providing a threat on its own. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and resource advantage.

The main goal of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo utilizing Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana, allowing for explosive plays and powerful spells to be cast quickly. The deck includes cards like Hidden Strings and Vizier of Tumbling Sands to untap Lotus Field multiple times, while also utilizing cards like Archdruid's Charm and Emergent Ultimatum to search for key pieces of the combo. The inclusion of cards like Soul Partition and Strict Proctor also helps to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck aims to win through overwhelming mana advantage and powerful spell casting.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on playing low-cost aggressive creatures and utilizing pump spells to deal quick and efficient damage to the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push to clear the way for your creatures to attack. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra level of consistency to the deck. With a mix of fast creatures, burn spells, and a solid mana base, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early pressure and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressively playing powerful creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Archfiend of the Dross to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's hand, while removal spells like Fatal Push and Heartless Act deal with threats on the board. The deck's mana base includes lands that provide both black and red mana, allowing for smooth and consistent casting of spells. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures with low mana costs to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It includes a mix of creatures with haste and pump spells to push through damage and finish the game quickly. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional mana fixing and a potential late-game threat. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy, with a mix of dual lands and utility lands to ensure consistent access to colored mana.

This deck focuses on utilizing Retraction Helix in combination with various cards like Jeskai Ascendancy, Emry, Lurker of the Loch, and Rona, Herald of Invasion to generate infinite loops and win the game through a powerful combo. The deck also includes cards like Mishra's Research Desk and Tormod's Crypt for disruption and protection. By efficiently using these cards and the mana base provided, the player can quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm their opponent with a burst of powerful synergies.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing cards and generating tokens with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Shark Typhoon. The deck includes powerful control cards like Deduce, Get Lost, and Memory Deluge to keep the opponent's threats in check. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, with a mix of utility lands like Eiganjo, Seat of the Empire and Field of Ruin. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a victory through resource management.

The main focus of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 UW Control deck is to establish control over the game through card advantage and disruption. The deck includes cards like Impulse, Memory Deluge, and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to draw cards and control the board. Farewell and Get Lost are used for disruption, while March of Otherworldly Light and The Wandering Emperor provide win conditions. Strict Proctor and Horned Loch-Whale are used for defensive purposes. The mana base includes lands like Hengegate Pathway and Lotus Field to ensure smooth mana production.

This deck focuses on casting spells to quickly and efficiently bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard to deal massive damage to the opponent. Key cards like Picklock Prankster and Artist's Talent help draw cards and fuel the graveyard. A mix of control spells like Spell Pierce and Lightning Axe help protect your creatures while also clearing the way for attacks. Treasure Cruise and Opt provide card advantage to keep the deck running smoothly. Overall, the strategy is to cast spells, generate value, and overwhelm the opponent with flying threats.

This mono black control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also removing threats on the board with cards like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict. It aims to control the game by forcing the opponent to play on the back foot, all while deploying powerful threats like Archfiend of the Dross and Graveyard Trespasser to close out the game. The deck utilizes lands like Mutavault and Castle Locthwain to provide additional utility and card advantage, ultimately grinding out victories through attrition and resource denial.

The main concept of this Dimir Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand while putting pressure on the board with evasive creatures. The deck aims to control the game by using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also utilizing creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Brazen Borrower to deal damage quickly. With a mix of aggressive creatures and removal spells, this deck can quickly overwhelm opponents and come out on top in a one-on-one matchup.

This deck focuses on sacrificing creatures to trigger powerful effects, dealing damage to the opponent consistently while generating value. By combining cards like Mayhem Devil and Cauldron Familiar with Witch's Oven, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Yggra, Eater of All adds a devastating finisher to the deck, allowing for explosive turns that can swing the game in your favor. Overall, this aggressive Jund deck looks to overwhelm opponents with a mixture of aggressive creatures and disruptive interactions.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on using a combination of sacrifice and removal cards to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total. By utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar, Mayhem Devil, and Witch's Oven, the deck can generate value from sacrificing creatures, while also applying pressure with aggressive threats like Bloodtithe Harvester and Ygra, Eater of All. The addition of the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional value and flexibility, allowing for a streamlined and efficient game plan focused on overwhelming the opponent with a relentless assault.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures with high power and utilizing pump spells to deal heavy damage to the opponent quickly. It includes efficient removal spells to clear the way for your attackers and disruption spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion helps to provide additional mana ramp and flexibility in play. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistency in casting your spells and maximizing the deck's potential for aggression. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and powerful creatures backed up by a suite of support cards.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays and dealing damage quickly to the opponent. It utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodtithe Harvester, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board and clear the way for attacks. The deck also includes some versatile instant spells and lands to provide additional options in different situations. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to apply pressure early and maintain a strong offensive presence throughout the game.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly by playing aggressive creatures such as Bloodtithe Harvester and Archfiend of the Dross. It also focuses on disruption with Thoughtseize and Duress to remove key cards from the opponent's hand. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat help clear the way for the aggro creatures to attack. Lastly, the mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for a variety of plays with lands like Mutavault and Blightstep Pathway.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodtithe Harvester, while also utilizing disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the game. The deck aims to quickly pressure opponents with its creatures and finish them off with powerful attacks. Additionally, the inclusion of Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and other high-impact cards provides additional late-game threats to secure victory. The mana base is constructed to support the deck's aggressive strategy and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly swarm the board with low-cost aggressive creatures, utilizing cards such as Monastery Swiftspear, Kumano Faces Kakkazan, and Emberheart Challenger. By leveraging the aggressive nature of these creatures, along with burn spells like Heartfire Hero and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds a versatile mana source to help cast spells efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless assault of creatures and burn spells.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures and disruptive elements to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By ramping up with Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, then following up with powerful creatures like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to control the board while dealing consistent damage. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Anointed Peacekeeper provide additional disruption, while Collected Company helps find key creatures efficiently. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistent early plays, ensuring a fast and aggressive start to dominate the game.

The deck focuses on rapidly deploying aggressive creatures to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Elite Spellbinder and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. It also uses cards like Archon of Emeria to slow down the opponent's spells and push through for damage. Collected Company provides additional creature threats, while cards like Skyclave Apparition and Enduring Innocence help maintain board control. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its efficient creatures and disruptive tactics, making it a formidable Aggro deck in Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage engines. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while drawing cards and gaining incremental advantages. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset provides additional card advantage and board control options. The mana base is built to support the control elements of the deck, with a mix of utility lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It aims to stall the game and outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with spells like Memory Deluge and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to further control the board and generate advantage. The mana base is designed to support the control elements of the deck, with a mix of lands that provide colored mana and utility to deal with the opponent's threats.

The main concept of this deck is to gain control over the opponent's board and resources by utilizing powerful creatures like Overlord of the Floodpits, Overlord of the Hauntwoods, and Overlord of the Mistmoors, alongside spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse. The deck also features Zur, Eternal Schemer as a key card to tutor for important pieces. The mana base includes a variety of lands to ensure consistency in casting spells and activating abilities, while Leyline Binding helps to control the opponent's movements. Ultimately, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and dominate the game.
